Reviews.Title: 3.1 megapixel quality images
Reviews.Author: Senior Frog "Hungry Man"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Fits in my pocketLarge LCD screenSells for well below retail price because it's got a major problemCons:Poor images (this is the major problem that's backed up by other reviewers on the "black" version of this camera)Proprietary batteryNo speaker in camera for playback soundI've used Olympus in the past with impressive results, but this camera should be an embarrassment to the committee that decided to release it to the public.Pay no more then $50 and don't buy it if you want sharp images. I'd compare the quality with my Sony 3.1 megapixel from 2005. Images will be fuzzy if viewed above a 5x7 size.The proprietary battery requires a charger that's the size of a pack of cigarettes. You can't charge with the USB cable so you may want to buy a second battery which lists for $44.99 ($15.00 street price). I would rather the camera be a little bigger and use AAA batteries then be stuck without a camera when the batteries died.Sound is recorded in movie mode, but you have to view on a computer or TV to hear the sound when played back. This camera has no speaker. Not a huge deal for me.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but not great
Reviews.Author: Xander and Patrick's Nana
Reviews.Content: I had ordered a Sony camera, and had given them the wrong zip code.  I got an email that the camera was being returned to the company.  I called that company and they confirmed that I would need to reorder it.  My class was going on a field trip in a few days, and I wanted the camera for that, so I quickly ordered another camera from Amazon.  I knew Amazon would get the camera to me in time, and they did. I bought this camera because it used the same batteries and memory card as my older Olympus, and I thought that would be helpful.  As it turned out, the other camera WAS delivered.  I decided to keep both of them, since both were inexpensive cameras, and I take a lot of pictures.  I had always been satisfied with my little Olympus camera, the 7.1 megapixel one.  But seeing the Sony pictures, and comparing them to this new Olympus, I realize the Olympus just isn't quite as good.  It's okay, and I will use it in the classroom, or when we go on field trips, because I wouldn't be quite as sorry to lose it or have it broken as I would the Sony.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problem (Or mabye Battery Reader?)
Reviews.Author: Ira Savatgy "Ira.S"
Reviews.Content: As with all the other reviews on this camera, It has a serious Battery problem.Either that or a Battery reader problem in the camera itself.After 5-10 photos with flash on a full battery, the camera will shut off with a "low battery" messageHowever,  if you wait a few minutes and than turn it back on again, you can take another 5 photos and than get thesame message with camera shut off.Even after that, you can still take more photos!The battery seems to be used amongst other Olympus cameras and they don't get bad reviews.And the batteries are super cheap too (about 8$ each) and only takes about 10 minutes to charge.This camera CANNOT take action shots!  they will be blurry.  Also there is no image stabilizer mode,so if you take a picture without a flash and your hands aren't perfectly still, than the picture will beblurry.However, the camera does take good still shots with a tripod. (or close up with a steady hand)When i purchased camera refurbished, it was 59$,  If i were you, i would not buy this camera until it comesdown to 40$UPDATE: after bout 4 months of super light use, the battery cannot even hold a charge. after a full charge, i can take maybe like 8 pictures?

Reviews.Title: worked fine for 3 years then died for no reason
Reviews.Author: S. Brusco "Sam Brusco"
Reviews.Content: I think you should expect a camera to last more than a few years.  I always kept it in its case.  I don't remember EVER dropping this camera, and I certainly didn't drop it just before it decided not to work any more.  I had a Canon Elph for several years and I did drop that one many times.While the camera is working, you can expect it to give you good quality photos and videos, but don't say I didn't warn you.  I'm going back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished as good as new
Reviews.Author: v1rotate
Reviews.Content: This was a refurbished FE-3010 Olympus camera. It was cheaper than getting my older camera, same model, repaired. It was under $50 delivered and arrived in a week. I used this camera during 5 days of diving recently (in the housing made for it) and it worked flawlessly.This was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: J. Wester
Reviews.Content: This is a handy little camera which is just the right size and with decent features for the money.  Unfortunately the images it produces are very low quality.  The images are out of focus and somewhat rotated from the image as it appeared on the LCD screen - (there goes the composition).  I've since replaced with a Canon ELPH300 which has wonderful image quality.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Gia
Reviews.Content: I am not an electronics person so just being able to aim and shoot is about all I want to do. I don't want to read manuals etc. I am able to figure out the different capabilities with each use. Still don't know what the gold piece is for that looks like a memory card but isn't. Took my memory card to CVS to have some pictures printed on the do it yourself machine and they were really really nice. I have no complaints about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Judy O
Reviews.Content: This camera was a replacement for the underwater housing I already own.  I dropped the first camera in a cold creek while on vacation in the mountains, no lanyard.  I was in need of a replacement so I could go diving and use the camera underwater.  this one was a perfect fit, and I am proud of my photography skills once again. Happy diver, Judy O.

Reviews.Title: Well-heeled little camera
Reviews.Author: ccoak
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, loaded with features, easy to use, excellent pictures.  The price is fantastic.
